title: Mixed-Methods Research Application Strategies for Selecting Science Competition Topics [Large-Scale]

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific research methodologies and experience in mathematical modeling
context.additional_context: Need for Professionals in Medical, Legal, and Technical Fields to Acquire Strategies Combining Experiential Approaches and Systematic Analysis When Selecting Science Competition Topics

learning_goals: Learners can design a science fair topic selection process using mixed research methodologies.
Learners can derive concrete indicators to evaluate the validity of topic selection through post-hoc control group design.
Learners can resolve practical problems arising during the topic selection process using the 'Guiding-Exposing-Investigating-Systematizing' framework.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
